author: Moyk
title: Developer Courses

assessments.note: There is not enough information to assess the alignment of the proposed challenge with Cardano's mission, I recommend that the proposer be more specific in describing the challenge.

It's in the best interest for the community to attract more education in cryptographic, programming languages and graphic design to increase the way the user interface the network and all the potentials it can bring in all areas of use. It is somewhat critical but not to the necessary extent of providing apprenticeships as such but a basic understanding to kick start interest and resources so an individual could fast track such endeavor and highlight a path forward bringing other developers that could train others deeply committed to it.
There are currently other projects already running that focus on teaching these skills to every member of the community who is interested.
courses , education are a key for cardano to succes indeed
Since Fund 3 there's a challenge named Developer Ecosystem, which includes topics described here.

Yes, Developer courses are important, but I strongly suggest to post this under the Developer Ecosystem campaign and to search for synergies/partnerships among similar proposals. I do not see this as legitimate Challenge Setting for Fund 6.
I can be hired as an apprentice software developer.
There is not enough information to assess the feasibility of the challenge, as the idea presented is extremely abstract.

There is a Fund 3 that focuses on education and many other projects in the pipeline seeking to tackle similar goals. It would be interesting to get in touch with such projects and present the idea for building along similar solutions to the same challenge. In principle the community is working on the Book of Cardano and aiding on training Marlowe, Haskell and Plutus programming languages.
I do not deem it feasible for a community to pay 25K USD to train one potential future developer without any guarantee of ROI.
